pageContext.description: Although this information appears below WIDITH, it appears to belong properly here:,  11   upper part with loop.,  12  upper part with loop & broken mouth.,  13  half with loop.,  14  fragment,  15  lower part,  17  lower part, with very thin edge,  18  lower part, heavy & battered,  20  lower part with straight edge,  21  lower part, very thick,  22  middle part,  ,
pageContext.other: First 3 lines of SITE info have been written over a white-out sticker, in a different handwriting., No illustration.,  ,
pageContext.associations: Howard of 9 socketed axes, 12 fragments, 1 rectangular implement, 1 spear-head, 1 base of sword-blade, 1 socket of knife & 18 copper cakes.
pageContext.publications: Proc. Soc. Antiq. sec. ii.  XIX, 14.
pageContext.rightCorner: RED DOT, followed by the notation in pencil "Frag"
pageContext.collection: British Museum,  1903-6-23      11-15, 17, 18, 20-22.,  Purchased from Messrs. Rottin & Fenardent,  6 Bloomsbury Street, W.C.,  1903
pageContext.site: GREATER LONDON, Tower Hamlets,  Bromley-by-Bow, Found at depth of 4'.6", between Devon's Road O& Brickfield Road, 1901
pageContext.remarks: The notation in pencil "C1" appears in the extreme, right lower corner.
